galaxy.name: Bima Sakti (Milky Way)
galaxy.description: Our home galaxy, a barred spiral galaxy containing billions of stars, including our solar system.

planets.name: Mercury
planets.description: The closest planet to the Sun and the smallest in our solar system. Despite its proximity, Mercury experiences extreme temperature variations.
planets.composition: Iron core (70%), rocky mantle, thin silicate crust
planets.atmosphere: Very thin, composed of oxygen, sodium, hydrogen, helium, and potassium
features: Largest temperature variation in the solar system
Ice exists in permanently shadowed craters

planets.name: Venus
planets.description: The hottest planet in our solar system, Venus is shrouded in thick clouds of sulfuric acid. It rotates backwards and has a runaway greenhouse effect.
planets.composition: Iron core, rocky mantle, thick silicate crust
planets.atmosphere: Dense, 96% carbon dioxide, 3.5% nitrogen, sulfuric acid clouds
features: Volcanic surface with thousands of volcanoes

planets.name: Earth

moonList.name: Moon
moonList.description: Earth's only natural satellite, the Moon influences tides and stabilizes Earth's axial tilt. It's the fifth largest moon in the solar system.
features: Largest moon relative to its planet

planets.description: Our home planet, the only known celestial body with life. Features liquid water, a protective atmosphere, and a magnetic field.
planets.composition: Iron-nickel core, silicate mantle, crust with oceans and continents

planets.name: Mars

moonList.name: Phobos
moonList.description: The larger and closer of Mars's two moons. Phobos is irregularly shaped and orbits very close to Mars, completing an orbit in less than a Martian day.
features: Will crash into Mars in ~50 million years

moonList.name: Deimos
moonList.description: The smaller and more distant of Mars's two moons. Deimos has a smoother surface than Phobos and takes longer to orbit Mars.

planets.description: The Red Planet, named for its iron oxide-rich surface. Once had flowing water and is a prime target for future human exploration.
planets.composition: Iron-nickel core, rocky mantle, iron-rich crust
features: Largest volcano in solar system (Olympus Mons)
Polar ice caps of water and carbon dioxide
Two small moons: Phobos and Deimos

planets.name: Jupiter

moonList.name: Io
moonList.description: The most volcanically active body in the solar system, with over 400 active volcanoes. Its surface is constantly being resurfaced by volcanic activity.
features: Most volcanically active body in solar system

moonList.name: Europa
moonList.description: An icy moon with a subsurface ocean that may contain more water than Earth. Considered one of the best candidates for finding extraterrestrial life.

moonList.name: Ganymede
moonList.description: The largest moon in the solar system, larger than Mercury. It has its own magnetic field and a subsurface ocean.
features: Mix of old dark terrain and young bright terrain

moonList.name: Callisto
moonList.description: The most heavily cratered object in the solar system. It's the outermost of Jupiter's four large Galilean moons.
features: Farthest from Jupiter of Galilean moons

moonList.name: Amalthea
moonList.description: The fifth-largest moon of Jupiter, located within the main ring. It's irregularly shaped and reddish in color.

moonList.name: Himalia
moonList.description: The largest irregular satellite of Jupiter. It's likely a captured asteroid from the outer solar system.

moonList.name: Thebe
moonList.description: The fourth-largest moon of Jupiter, located within the main ring. It's irregularly shaped.

moonList.name: Metis
moonList.description: The innermost moon of Jupiter, located within the main ring. It's one of the smallest moons.

moonList.name: Adrastea
moonList.description: The second-innermost moon of Jupiter and one of the smallest. It's located within the main ring.

moonList.name: Carme
moonList.description: A retrograde irregular moon of Jupiter, likely a captured asteroid. It's part of the Carme group.

moonList.name: Pasiphae
moonList.description: A retrograde irregular moon of Jupiter and the largest member of the Pasiphae group. Likely a captured asteroid.

moonList.name: Sinope
moonList.description: A retrograde irregular moon of Jupiter, likely a captured asteroid. It has a very dark surface.

planets.description: The largest planet in our solar system, a gas giant with a Great Red Spot storm larger than Earth. Has a strong magnetic field and many moons.
planets.composition: Dense core of rock and ice, thick layer of liquid metallic hydrogen, outer layer of molecular hydrogen and helium
planets.atmosphere: 90% hydrogen, 10% helium, traces of methane, water, ammonia
features: Strongest magnetic field in solar system
79 known moons (including the four Galilean moons)
Acts as a cosmic vacuum cleaner

planets.name: Saturn

moonList.name: Titan
moonList.description: Saturn's largest moon and the second-largest moon in the solar system. It has a thick atmosphere and liquid hydrocarbon lakes on its surface.

moonList.name: Enceladus
moonList.description: A small, icy moon with geysers of water vapor and ice particles erupting from its south pole. Has a subsurface ocean.

moonList.name: Mimas
moonList.description: Known as the 'Death Star' moon due to its large crater. It's the smallest astronomical body known to be rounded by its own gravity.

moonList.name: Rhea
moonList.description: Saturn's second-largest moon. It has a heavily cratered surface and may have a tenuous ring system.
features: Mix of old and young terrain

moonList.name: Iapetus
moonList.description: Known for its dramatic two-tone coloration - one side is dark, the other is bright. Has a prominent equatorial ridge.

moonList.name: Dione
moonList.description: A medium-sized moon with a heavily cratered surface and bright wispy features that are actually ice cliffs.

moonList.name: Tethys
moonList.description: A medium-sized moon with a large impact crater called Odysseus and a huge valley called Ithaca Chasma.

moonList.name: Hyperion
moonList.description: An irregularly shaped moon with a sponge-like appearance. It has a chaotic rotation and is one of the largest irregular moons.

moonList.name: Phoebe
moonList.description: A retrograde irregular moon, likely a captured object from the Kuiper Belt. It's very dark and has a retrograde orbit.

moonList.name: Janus
moonList.description: A small moon that shares its orbit with Epimetheus. They periodically swap orbits in a unique orbital dance.

moonList.name: Epimetheus
moonList.description: A small moon that shares its orbit with Janus. They periodically swap orbits in a unique orbital dance.

moonList.name: Prometheus
moonList.description: An inner shepherd moon that helps maintain Saturn's F ring. It's elongated and potato-shaped.

moonList.name: Pandora
moonList.description: An inner shepherd moon that helps maintain Saturn's F ring. It's elongated and irregularly shaped.

planets.description: Famous for its spectacular ring system. The least dense planet, it would float in water. Has a hexagonal storm at its north pole.
planets.composition: Rocky core, layer of liquid metallic hydrogen, liquid hydrogen and helium, gaseous atmosphere
planets.atmosphere: 96% hydrogen, 3% helium, traces of methane and ammonia
features: Spectacular ring system (ice and rock particles)
146 known moons including Titan (larger than Mercury)
Hexagonal storm pattern at north pole

planets.name: Uranus

moonList.name: Titania
moonList.description: Uranus's largest moon, named after the queen of the fairies in Shakespeare's A Midsummer Night's Dream. It has a mix of cratered and smooth terrain.
features: Mix of old and young terrain

moonList.name: Oberon
moonList.description: Uranus's second-largest moon and outermost major moon. It has a dark, heavily cratered surface with bright material in some craters.

planets.description: An ice giant that rotates on its side. Its blue-green color comes from methane in its atmosphere. Has faint rings and 27 moons.
planets.composition: Rocky core, mantle of water, methane, and ammonia ices, atmosphere of hydrogen and helium
features: Coldest planetary atmosphere in solar system

planets.name: Neptune

moonList.name: Triton
moonList.description: Neptune's largest moon and the only large moon with a retrograde orbit. It's geologically active with nitrogen geysers and has a thin atmosphere.
features: Likely a captured Kuiper Belt object

planets.description: The windiest planet with speeds up to 2,100 km/h. Deep blue color from methane. The farthest planet from the Sun.
planets.composition: Rocky core, mantle of water, methane, and ammonia ices, atmosphere of hydrogen, helium, and methane
features: Fastest winds in solar system (up to 2,100 km/h)

Terrestrial.description: Rocky planets with solid surfaces, located in the inner solar system

Gas Giant.description: Large planets primarily composed of hydrogen and helium

Ice Giant.description: Planets with significant amounts of water, methane, and ammonia ices

notes.title: Scale and Distance
notes.content: The distances in this visualization are not to scale. In reality, planets are millions of kilometers apart, and the solar system spans billions of kilometers.

notes.title: Rotation Speeds
notes.content: Each planet has different rotation speeds. Gas giants rotate faster than terrestrial planets. The speed controls allow you to visualize these differences.

notes.title: Milky Way Galaxy
notes.content: Our solar system is located in the Orion Arm of the Milky Way galaxy, about 27,000 light-years from the galactic center. It takes about 225-250 million years for our solar system to complete one orbit around the galaxy.

notes.title: Planet Colors
notes.content: Planet colors are based on their actual appearance as seen from space probes. These colors come from their surface composition and atmospheric gases.
